TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed SiteMapSection extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection
Public NotInheritable Class SiteMapSection Inherits ConfigurationSection

Docs.summary: Defines configuration settings that are used to support the infrastructure for configuring, storing, and rendering site navigation. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection> class provides a way to programmatically access and modify the content of the configuration file `siteMap` section.
## Examples This example demonstrates how to specify values declaratively for several attributes of the `siteMap` section, which can also be accessed as members of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection> class.
The following configuration file example shows how to specify values declaratively for the `siteMap` section.
``` <system.web> <siteMap defaultProvider="XmlSiteMapReader" enabled="true"> <providers> <clear /> <add name="XmlSiteMapReader" type="XmlSiteMapProvider, System.Web, Version=1.1.3300.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a" siteMapFile="my.sitemap" description="XmlSiteMapProvider that loads my.sitemap"/> </providers> </siteMap> </system.web> ```
The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection> class.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection/CS/sitemapsection.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection/VB/sitemapsection.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection.%23ctor> constructor is not intended to be used directly from your code. It is called by the ASP.NET configuration system. You obtain an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection> class by using the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.GetSection%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ DefaultProvider { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.DefaultProvider : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the default navigation provider.
Docs.value: The name of a provider in the property or a field. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Navigation providers expose an API for manipulating navigation values in a common fashion. You can specify navigation providers in the `providers` subsection of the `siteMap` section of a configuration file.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection.DefaultProvider%2A> property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection> class.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection/CS/sitemapsection.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection/VB/sitemapsection.vb#2)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool Enabled { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.Enabled : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ASP.NET site map feature is enabled.
Docs.value: if the ASP.NET site map feature is enabled; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection.Enabled%2A> property returns a Boolean value indicating whether or not the ASP.NET navigation feature can be accessed at run time.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection.Enabled%2A> property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection> class.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection/CS/sitemapsection.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection/VB/sitemapsection.vb#3)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Providers As ProviderSettingsCollection

Docs.value: A that contains the providers settings defined within the subsection of the section of the configuration file.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Site map providers are components that provide access to the navigation structure for a site. You can specify site map providers in the `providers` subsection of the `siteMap` section of a configuration file.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection.DefaultProvider%2A> property names which provider is used by default.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection.Providers%2A> property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection> class.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection/CS/sitemapsection.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.SiteMapSection/VB/sitemapsection.vb#4)]
